record.name: online
record.description: Returns whether the entity identified by the notification-uri parameter to the notify_method_capability test can receive a notify notification immediately.
record.syntax: Can contain one of three values: "yes", "no" and "maybe". Values MUST be in lowercase.

record.name: busy
record.description: An indication of whether the user is considered "busy" now (the value "yes") or not (the value "no"). The meaning of "busy" is left to the implementation, and may be a state that's synthesized from other information.
record.syntax: Has one of the values "yes", "no", or "unknown". The value MUST be in lower case.

record.name: show
record.description: The availability status of the user. This is similar to the presence element with the same name that's defined in Section 4.7.2.1 of RFC 6121.
record.syntax: Has one of the values "away", "chat", "dnd", "offline", "xa", or "unknown". The value MUST be in lower case.

record.name: status
record.description: A human-readable description of the user's availability status. This is similar to the presence element with the same name that's defined in Section 4.7.2.2 of RFC 6121.
record.syntax: There is no formal definition for the values this item may take. It is free-form and may be in any language, and is meant for human consumption.
